# BINP16_HomeExam_Todreas_2025

*Oliver Todreas 2025*
Complete documentation of my home exam for BINP16.

## Directory Structure (Non-hidden Files)

```markdown
root/
├── docs/
│   └── BINP16_programming_home_exam_10-2025.pdf
├── scripts/
│   ├── answers/
│   │   ├── bash/
│   │   │   ├── README.md
│   │   │   └── TodreasQ1.sh
│   │   ├── python/
│   │   │   ├── _helper.py
│   │   │   ├── 2_output_Todreas.txt
│   │   │   ├── 2.py
│   │   │   ├── 3_output_Todreas_line2.png
│   │   │   ├── 3_output_Todreas_line4.png
│   │   │   ├── 3.py
│   │   │   ├── input_Todreas.txt
│   │   │   └── README.md
│   ├── examples/  # As generated by manage_examples.py.
│   │   ├── ...
│   │   │   └── ...
│   ├── Notes.ipynb  # Notebook file I used to try out ideas.
│   └── manage_examples.py
└── README.md
```

Note that if you run `ls -a` in bash you will find files like `.gitignore`
or jupyter checkpoints since I use GitHub to save my progress to the cloud
and jupyter notebooks for notes (don't worry, I kept the repository for this
exam private).

## Procedure

Navigate to the file `root/scripts/answers/bash/README.md` or
`root/scripts/answers/python/README.md` and follow the instructions on how to
generate my answers. Generally, you need to be inside the designated answer
directory to generate reproducible results.
In the case of the bash question, ...
In the case of the python questions, simply run the files with no arguments
besides the file names. The inputs, outputs, and parameters have default
values to ensure reproducibility. New output files will be generated that match
the output files already present in the directory.
